channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The NYC Marathon’s Final Finishers
item.description: Two runners with injuries ended the New York City Marathon on their own two feet — and a pair of crutches.

item.title: Heavy Rains Hit Spain, Still Reeling From Deadly Flooding
item.description: Emergency workers continued the search for victims of last week’s flash floods, while a national debate raged over who was to blame for the catastroph...

item.title: Wall Street’s Trump trade unravels after a shock poll dented his election odds
item.description: The dollar, Treasury yields, and Bitcoin fell on Monday after a closely watched poll over the weekend showed Harris with a lead in Iowa.

item.title: Iranians Wonder if Trump Wins, Would Things Be Different This Time?
item.description: While Donald J. Trump is seen by many in Tehran as having been disastrous for their country, some hope he might be more open to negotiation in a secon...

item.title: Elon Musk joins a chorus of conservatives turning the euthanized ‘Peanut the squirrel’ into a symbol of ‘government overreach’
item.description: The internet-famous squirrel was seized by the New York Department of Environmental Conservation Wednesday over safety and legal concerns.

item.title: Indonesian Tribe Adopts Korean Hangul to Preserve Ancient Cia-Cia Language
item.description: The Cia-Cia language has been passed down orally for centuries. Now the tribe’s children are learning to write it in Hangul, the Korean script.

item.title: Murray McCory, 80, Dies; JanSport Founder Created the School Backpack
item.description: He brought lightweight packs to millions of students and transformed the way they carried their textbooks to school.

item.title: Sydney to Become Seventh World Major Marathon in 2025
item.description: The Sydney Marathon has joined the ranks of New York, Boston, Chicago, London, Berlin and Tokyo, receiving a designation reserved for the most elite r...

item.title: Over 60% of homeowners go into debt for renovations they wish they hadn’t done, study finds
item.description: About 1 in 9 homeowners disliked their post-renovation home, and nearly half of renovators said they liked their home better before they renovated.

item.title: Supreme Court to Hear Louisiana Voting Map Dispute
item.description: The case, which will not affect this election cycle, involves a legal fight over how the state draws its voting maps and could determine the political...

item.title: Berkshire Hathaway is dumping Apple stock and building its cash stockpile to record highs because Warren Buffett believes the government will raise capital gains taxes soon
item.description: The company’s cash and short-term treasuries now outweigh the market value of its equities.

item.title: From ‘nauseously optimistic’ to ‘headline stress disorder,’ how to deal with your election anxiety
item.description: You're not alone: 77% of Americans are stressed about the future of the country, finds a new poll. Here's how to calm down.

item.title: Energized but Uneasy, the Campaigns Make Frantic Final Pushes
item.description: Democrats in battleground states have built a tightly structured get-out-the-vote operation, while Republicans have relied more on outside groups for ...

item.title: Women’s Anger Might Save Us From Trump
item.description: If Trump loses on Tuesday, we’ll know why.

item.title: Tuesday Briefing: Americans brace for Election Day
